symptoms.name: Pus-filled areas (abscesses) surrounded by bumpy tissue
Tunneling wound with yellowish pus and sulfur granules
Symptoms may not develop for months or years after infection starts

physical_findings: Ducts formed from inflamed area to other body areas
Necrosis with yellowish sulfur granules and filamentous Gram-positive fungal-like pathogens

lab_values.Gram stain: Non-spore-forming Gram-positive rods (except A. meyeri, which is small and nonbranching; other species are branching filamentous rods)
lab_values.Culture: Slow growth (5-20 days), requires anaerobic conditions, may be negative due to prior antibiotic use or inadequate culture conditions

required: Identification of Actinomyces spp. from a sterile site (culture or histopathology)
supportive: Positive Gram stain showing Gram-positive filamentous bacteria
